content.body:
Yoav Weiss: For Mozilla Developer Network docs, can you please confirm that the device client hints that disappeared from the spec after https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-client-hints-06 are deprecated (were removed permanently from the spec and have not been moved elsewhere)? 

Specifically, Content-DPR, DPR, Viewport-Width, Width
content.formatted_body:
Yoav Weiss: For Mozilla Developer Network docs, can you please confirm that the device client hints that disappeared from the spec after https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-client-hints-06 are deprecated (were removed permanently from the spec and have not been moved elsewhere)?

Specifically, Content-DPR, DPR, Viewport-Width, Width

content.body: Hamish Willee: It was removed from the ID to be moved to other specs. See https://wicg.github.io/responsive-image-client-hints/ for the current spec for image-related client hints
content.formatted_body: Hamish Willee: It was removed from the ID to be moved to other specs. See https://wicg.github.io/responsive-image-client-hints/ for the current spec for image-related client hints

content.body: This is the PR that removed the features: https://github.com/httpwg/http-extensions/pull/775
@jakea:matrix.org Hey, I looked into the GC issue. I’ll comment on the crbug tomorrow, but I think it turns out to be pretty subtle, and may have also exposed a bug in MutationObserver
content.formatted_body: @jakea:matrix.org Hey, I looked into the GC issue. I’ll comment on the crbug tomorrow, but I think it turns out to be pretty subtle, and may have also exposed a bug in MutationObserver

content.body:
timothygu: Thanks very much! Can you confirm the summary of the changes:
- Width, Viewport-Width, DPR were deprecated and replaced by same haders with Sec-CH- prefix (e.g. Sec-CH-DPR)
- New header Sec-CH-Viewport-Height
- Removal of Content-DPR altogether?

As a slight aside, one of the examples in the spec appears to omit the SEC- prefix in the Accept-CH - is that OK?:
Accept-CH: CH-DPR, CH-Width
content.formatted_body:
timothygu: Thanks very much! Can you confirm the summary of the changes:

  • Width, Viewport-Width, DPR were deprecated and replaced by same haders with Sec-CH- prefix (e.g. Sec-CH-DPR)
  • New header Sec-CH-Viewport-Height
  • Removal of Content-DPR altogether?

As a slight aside, one of the examples in the spec appears to omit the SEC- prefix in the Accept-CH - is that OK?:
Accept-CH: CH-DPR, CH-Width

content.body: @hamishwillee:matrix.org I don’t have any info beyond the links I sent, but it’s worth going through the PRs to that spec to understand historical changes. Re the example omission, you could file an issue on GitHub for clarification
content.formatted_body: @hamishwillee:matrix.org I don’t have any info beyond the links I sent, but it’s worth going through the PRs to that spec to understand historical changes. Re the example omission, you could file an issue on GitHub for clarification
